social_jobs.job: Be seen as someone who makes smart, data-driven health decisions
social_jobs.context: When discussing health optimization with other engineers/biohackers in my network
social_jobs.outcome: Respect from peers for rigorous approach, asked for advice on health optimization
social_jobs.current_struggle: Don't want to recommend something that turns out to be snake oil

social_jobs.job: Contribute to the quantified self community knowledge base
social_jobs.context: When I want to share my N=1 results and help others optimize
social_jobs.outcome: Publish detailed Reddit post or blog with my data, help others make informed decisions
social_jobs.current_struggle: Need something worth sharing - proven intervention with trackable results

emotional_jobs.job: Feel in control of my health through data and optimization
emotional_jobs.context: When I'm tracking everything (sleep, HRV, food, supplements) and want to see clear cause-effect
emotional_jobs.outcome: Clear correlation between intervention and biomarker improvement in my tracking dashboard
emotional_jobs.current_struggle: Too many variables, hard to isolate what's actually working

emotional_jobs.job: Avoid wasting money on ineffective health products
emotional_jobs.context: When I've tried 5+ supplements that didn't work and feel like an idiot for falling for marketing
emotional_jobs.outcome: Confidence that this is evidence-based and will show results in my N=1 data
emotional_jobs.current_struggle: Supplement industry is full of BS, hard to separate signal from noise

emotional_jobs.job: Feel like I'm investing in longevity, not just treating symptoms
emotional_jobs.context: When I think about healthspan and want to prevent decline in my 40s-60s
emotional_jobs.outcome: Sense that I'm building a foundation for long-term health, not just band-aid solutions
emotional_jobs.current_struggle: Most health products are reactive, not preventive/optimization focused

functional_jobs.job: Optimize gut health to improve energy and mental clarity
functional_jobs.context: When I need sustained energy for 10-12 hour coding sessions without crashes
functional_jobs.outcome: Stable energy levels tracked via Whoop recovery score >70%, no afternoon crashes
functional_jobs.current_struggle: Current probiotics inconsistent, energy still dips after lunch, brain fog around 3pm

functional_jobs.job: Reduce gut-related inflammation to improve overall health markers
functional_jobs.context: When I get bloodwork done and see elevated inflammatory markers (CRP, etc)
functional_jobs.outcome: Measurable reduction in inflammation biomarkers in next quarterly labs
functional_jobs.current_struggle: Unclear which intervention (diet, supplements, exercise) actually moves the needle

functional_jobs.job: Support immune function to minimize sick days
functional_jobs.context: When cold/flu season hits or after travel and I can't afford downtime
functional_jobs.outcome: Fewer sick days (currently 4-6/year, target <2/year), faster recovery when sick
functional_jobs.current_struggle: Generic immune supplements don't seem to help, gut-immune connection unclear

functional_jobs.job: Improve nutrient absorption to maximize diet efforts
functional_jobs.context: When I'm already eating clean but not seeing expected results in biomarkers
functional_jobs.outcome: Better vitamin D/B12/iron levels without increasing intake, improved gut lining markers
functional_jobs.current_struggle: Spending money on high-quality food but absorption may be the bottleneck

job_priority_ranking: 1. Optimize gut health for energy/clarity (immediate daily impact, trackable). 2. Feel in control through data (emotional need that drives all decisions). 3. Reduce inflammation markers (quarterly lab validation, long-term health). 4. Avoid wasting money on BS (painful past experiences, high skepticism). 5. Support immune function (seasonal priority, measurable sick days). 6. Be seen as data-driven (social validation within community). 7. Improve nutrient absorption (longer-term optimization, harder to measure). 8. Invest in longevity (important but abstract, harder to validate short-term). 9. Contribute to QS community (nice-to-have, happens if #1-2 are satisfied).
job_dependencies: Core dependency: Must see measurable results in tracked data within 90 days, or all other jobs fail. Energy optimization job depends on: baseline tracking system already in place (Whoop/Oura), consistent routine to isolate variables, clear start/end markers. Inflammation reduction job depends on: recent bloodwork baseline, willingness to wait 3 months for next labs, other variables controlled (diet, exercise stable). Social jobs depend on: functional jobs succeeding first, must have data to share, community receptive to the product. Emotional 'control' job depends on: transparent company data, clear mechanism of action, ability to track daily, no black-box solutions. Money-saving job depends on: clear ROI calculation framework, comparison vs current stack cost, refund policy safety net. Sequence: First establish baseline data → trial intervention → measure at 30/60/90 days → if positive, continue and share socially → if negative, refund and try next solution.
